Posts.Content: PrncessRnnr,I am really glad to hear everything else came out good .I am in the same boat as you . I had a wire guided biopsy ,doctor said he probably got it all out .He didn't ! then a lumpectomy on june 10, went to oncologist hoping to start rads and he says it still is not good enough only 1 cm clean margins.so I also am leaning towards mast with reconstuctive surgery at the same time.good luck and keep us posted as to how you are doing.(((HUGS))) Robin
Posts.Title: Scared, waiting for results

Posts.Content: I just had the same as you have .I went to my surgeon on may 5th.They have me scheduled for a wire guided biopsy on the 18th .next wed. This has been a long process. hope things go okay with you. will be thinking about you .
Posts.Title: Calcifications 1 2

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply smithn.I will do just that tomorrow .I will get the report so maybe I can find out what is going on. she said it was pre-cancerous. is this the same as dcis which i have read alot on here.I know I should be very grateful she did not say malignant as a lot of women have had worse test results and my heart goes out to them.
Posts.Title: Biopsy results are non malignant/non benign/precancerous

Posts.Content: Carguy, This certainly is the place to be there is lots of wonderful people on here who will be able to give you some answers.I also am very thankful your wife insisted on having it removed.The waiting part is the hardest as our minds always seem to think the worst.with myself recently being diagnosed,and knowing how many BC survivors there are out there Does make it easier. Best of luck to you and your wife, hope everything comes out good.Robin
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed

Posts.Content: Tinamarie The best thing you can do is see your gyn. as others on this board have said NO lump should be left unchecked. One time I did have a red spot on the side of my breast.It was kind of like a boil.It was red ,Then started draining later and just went away.My breast have never been the same size right one always bigger. when I went for my mammo I was just going for routine check as I did not feel any lump.I was diagnosed with DCIS. which is early stage cancer.So definitely get this checked out .Best of luck to you .Hope everything comes out clean.Robin
Posts.Title: Question about red spot on breast

Posts.Content: I talked to the nurse today .doctor was unavailable.she said doc wanted her to tell me it was not malignant but it also was not benign. That it was pre cancerous and we would have to keep a eye on it .Has any one else had these results. I don't go back to doctor till may 31st so .I can not even ask him questions any one else have these results and what did you do as follow ups .I would appreciate any info. Thanks in advance. Robin
Posts.Title: Biopsy results are non malignant/non benign/precancerous

Posts.Content: Michelle , another member on here Franksupporter had a wire guided biopsy and it came back good .try to think positive till you know otherwise.I know this is very hard as I have been going thru the same thing .The hurry up and wait is what drives a person crazy.I also had the wire guided biopsy.my results were DCIS high grade so I just had a lumpectomy,to get clear margins.the worst part was going thru putting the wires in ,as it took time to make sure they were in the right place and deep enough . Good luck ,Robin
Posts.Title: Need Reassurance regarding Complex Sclerosis Lesion

Posts.Content: Michelev My mammogram showed calcifications.So then I went for spot compression.Yes I would say it is the same as lumpectomy.as I had both on Friday I went in for the Lumpectomy which they reopened the 2 1/2 inch excisional biopsy and just took out more tissue to get good margins .when are you scheduled for this? The hardest part for me was staying compressed in the mammo machine while they checked xrays several times . Keep us updated on how you are doing .Robin
Posts.Title: Need Reassurance regarding Complex Sclerosis Lesion
